name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 1/2 cups basmati rice; 500g chicken, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 1 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 potatoes, peeled and quartered; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; 1/2 cup chopped mint leaves; 1/2 cup chopped coriander leaves; Salt, to taste
recipe: For chicken biryani: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large pan, heat oil and ghee. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside. Layer the cooked chicken masala and partially cooked rice in a large pot. Top with the reserved fried onions. Cover the pot with a tight lid and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until the rice is fully cooked and aromatic. Serve hot with raita or salad.

Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Let the mixture cool down, then blend into a smooth paste. Transfer the paste back to the pan and add yogurt, cream, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the flavors are well combined. Add cubed paneer and simmer until heated through. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan.

name: Chicken Handi
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cream; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
recipe: For chicken handi: Heat oil in a pan and add thinly sliced onions. sauteuntil golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Add yogurt, cream, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the chicken is tender and the gravy thickens. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Lahori Fish
ingredients: 300g fish fillets (like tilapia or cod); 1 cup gram flour (besan); 2 tablespoons rice flour; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For Lahori fish: In a bowl, mix gram flour, rice flour, red chili powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Add water gradually to make a thick batter. Dip fish fillets in the batter and fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

name: Chicken Jalfrezi
ingredients: 300g chicken, cut into strips; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 bell peppers, sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
recipe: For chicken jalfrezi: Heat oil in a pan and add thinly sliced onions. sauteuntil golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add sliced bell peppers and cook until slightly tender. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add chicken strips and cook until they are no longer pink. Add yogurt, red chili powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Achari Gosht
ingredients: 300g mutton, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; 1 teaspoon fennel seeds; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
recipe: For achari gosht: Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add fenugreek seeds, fennel seeds, and mustard seeds. sauteuntil fragrant. Add thinly sliced onions and sauteuntil golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add mutton pieces and cook until they are browned. Add yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add water and pressure cook until the mutton is tender. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chicken Chapli Kebab
ingredients: 500g minced chicken; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For chicken chapli kebab: In a mixing bowl, combine minced chicken, chopped onion, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. Divide the mixture into equal-sized portions and shape them into flat patties. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the kebabs until they are golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken Salad
ingredients: 200g chicken breast, grilled and sliced; Mixed salad greens; 1 cucumber, sliced; 1 bell pepper, diced; 1 tomato, diced; 1/4 cup sliced red onion; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; 1 teaspoon dried oregano; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For grilled lemon herb chicken salad: In a large bowl, combine the mixed salad greens, cucumber, bell pepper, tomato, and red onion. Top with grilled chicken slices. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

name: Murgh Chicken with Shan Masala
ingredients: 300g chicken breast diced; 3 tablespoons Shan Chicken Masala; 2 tablespoons yogurt; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; 2 tablespoons oil; Salt to taste; Chopped coriander leaves for garnish; Sliced onions and lemon wedges for serving
recipe: Marinate the Chicken: In a bowl mix Shan Chicken Masala yogurt lemon juice and salt. Add diced chicken breast to the mixture. Ensure each piece is coated evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally until the chicken is cooked through and slightly browned. Adjust salt if necessary.

name: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
ingredients: 1 cup cooked lentils; Assorted vegetables (such as carrots, celery, and spinach), diced; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 4 cups vegetable broth; 1 teaspoon dried thyme; 1 teaspoon dried oregano; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For lentil and vegetable soup: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sautefor 1 minute. Add assorted diced vegetables and cook until slightly softened. Add cooked lentils, vegetable broth, dried thyme, and dried oregano. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Chicken White Karhai with Shan Masala
ingredients: 100g boneless chicken, cut into cubes; 1 cup yogurt; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 3 green chilies, chopped; 3 tablespoons Shan Chicken White Karhai Masala; 1/4 cup oil; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; Salt to taste; Chopped coriander leaves for garnish
recipe: 1. Marinate the Chicken: In a bowl; mix chicken cubes with yogurt; Shan Chicken White Karhai Masala; ginger paste ;garlic paste; and salt. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour. 2. Cooking: Heat oil in a karhai or deep skillet over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. 3. Add the marinated chicken mixture to the karhai. Cook for 15-20 minutes ; stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the oil separates from the masala. 4. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice. Enjoy your delicious Chicken White Karhai made with Shan Masala!

name: Punjabi Chicken Pulao
ingredients: 200g chicken breast; 1/6 cup basmati rice, 1 onions (thinly sliced), 2 tomatoes (chopped); 2 tablespoons Shan Chicken Pulao Masala; 2 tablespoons oil; 4 cups water; Salt to taste; Fresh coriander leaves for garnish; Fried onions for garnish;1. Rinse 1 cup of basmati rice and soak for 30 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a pot and sautethinly sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 4. Add 500g diced chicken breast and cook until sealed. 5. Add 2 tablespoons Shan Chicken Pulao Masala and mix well. 6. Drain soaked rice and add it to the pot. Stir until combined. 7. Add 4 cups of water and salt to taste. Bring to a boil. 8. Reduce heat; cover
recipe: and simmer until rice is cooked and water is absorbed. 9. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and fried onions. 10. Serve hot and enjoy the delicious Punjabi Chicken Pulao!"

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1/2 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed; 1 cucumber, diced; 1 tomato, diced; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 1/4 cup sliced Kalamata olives; 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For Mediterranean chickpea salad: In a large bowl; combine the chickpeas; cucumber; tomato; red onion; Kalamata olives; crumbled feta cheese, and chopped fresh parsley. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Egg Salad Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: 4 hard-boiled eggs, chopped; 1/4 cup Greek yogurt; 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard; 1/4 cup diced celery; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives; Salt and pepper, to taste; Large lettuce leaves
recipe: For egg salad lettuce wraps: In a bowl, mix together chopped hard-boiled eggs, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, diced celery, diced red onion, chopped fresh chives, salt, and pepper until well combined. Spoon the egg salad mixture onto large lettuce leaves. Roll up the lettuce leaves to form wraps. Serve immediately.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cups cauliflower rice; 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (such as peas, carrots, and corn); 2 eggs, beaten; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce; 1 tablespoon sesame oil; 1/4 cup chopped green onions
recipe: For cauliflower fried rice: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sautefor 1 minute. Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender. Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix with the vegetables. Add cauliflower rice and low-sodium soy sauce to the skillet. Stir-fry until everything is heated through. Garnish with chopped green onions. Serve hot.

name: Greek Chicken Salad
ingredients: 200g grilled chicken breast, sliced; Mixed salad greens; 1 cucumber, sliced; 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved; 1/4 cup sliced red onion; 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese; 2 tablespoons sliced Kalamata olives; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For Greek chicken salad: In a large bowl, combine mixed salad greens, cucumber slices, cherry tomatoes, red onion slices, crumbled feta cheese, sliced Kalamata olives, and chopped fresh parsley. Top with grilled chicken slices. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

name: Cauliflower and Chickpea Curry
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, cut into florets; 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed; 1 onion, diced; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 can coconut milk; 2 tablespoons curry powder; 1 teaspoon turmeric; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro, for garnish
recipe: For cauliflower and chickpea curry: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic, and sauteuntil softened. Add cauliflower florets and chickpeas, and cook for a few minutes. Stir in curry powder and turmeric, and cook until fragrant. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes until cauliflower is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Greek Yogurt Chicken Salad
ingredients: 200g cooked chicken breast, shredded; 1/4 cup Greek yogurt; 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; 1/4 cup diced celery; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 1/4 cup halved grapes; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For Greek yogurt chicken salad: In a bowl, mix together shredded cooked chicken breast, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, diced celery, diced red onion, halved grapes, salt, and pepper until well combined. Serve chilled or in a whole wheat pita pocket for a sandwich.

name: Lentil and Spinach Salad
ingredients: 1/2 cup cooked lentils; 2 cups fresh spinach leaves; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For lentil and spinach salad: In a large bowl, combine cooked lentils, fresh spinach leaves, diced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped fresh parsley. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Achari Bhindi Gosht
ingredients: 500g Gosht, cut into pieces; 250g okra (bhindi), trimmed and sliced; 3 tablespoons National Achari Masala; 2 onions, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, slit; 1/4 cup yogurt; 2 tablespoons oil; 2 teaspoons ginger paste; 2 teaspoons garlic paste; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
recipe: 1. Marinate the Lamb: In a bowl, mix National Achari Masala with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt. Add lamb pieces to the mixture. Ensure each piece is coated evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. Cooking: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add finely chopped onions and sauteuntil golden brown. Add marinated lamb and cook until it turns brown. Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add sliced okra and cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Serve: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chicken Karele
ingredients: 500g chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces; 3 medium-sized bitter gourds (karela), thinly sliced; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, slit; 2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 1 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
recipe: 1. Prepare the Bitter Gourd: Sprinkle salt over the sliced bitter gourds and set aside for 15 minutes. This helps to reduce bitterness. After 15 minutes, rinse the bitter gourds under cold water and squeeze out excess water. Cooking: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and garam masala. Mix well. Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Add the sliced bitter gourds and slit green chilies. Mix everything well. Cover and cook on low heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the bitter gourds are tender. Adjust salt according to taste. Serve: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Mediterranean Chicken Salad
ingredients: 100g grilled chicken breast, sliced; Mixed salad greens; 1 cucumber, sliced; 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved; 1/4 cup sliced red onion; 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese; 2 tablespoons sliced Kalamata olives; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For Mediterranean chicken salad: In a large bowl, combine mixed salad greens, cucumber slices, cherry tomatoes, red onion slices, crumbled feta cheese, sliced Kalamata olives, and chopped fresh parsley. Top with grilled chicken slices. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

name: Greek Yogurt Chicken Wrap
ingredients: 100g cooked chicken breast, shredded; 1/4 cup Greek yogurt; 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; 1/4 cup diced celery; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 1/4 cup halved grapes; Salt and pepper, to taste; Whole wheat tortilla wrap
recipe: For Greek yogurt chicken wrap: In a bowl, mix together shredded cooked chicken breast, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, diced celery, diced red onion, halved grapes, salt, and pepper until well combined. Spread the Greek yogurt chicken mixture onto a whole wheat tortilla wrap. Roll up the wrap tightly and slice in half diagonally. Serve immediately.

name: Lentil and Spinach Soup
ingredients: 1 cup cooked lentils; 2 cups fresh spinach leaves; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 4 cups vegetable broth; 1 teaspoon dried thyme; 1 teaspoon dried rosemary; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For lentil and spinach soup: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and diced red onion, and sauteuntil softened. Add fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted. Stir in cooked lentils, vegetable broth, dried thyme, and dried rosemary. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Potato and Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1 large potato, boiled and diced; 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed; 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; 1 tablespoon olive oil; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For potato and chickpea salad: In a large bowl, combine diced boiled potato, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, diced red onion, and chopped fresh parsley. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Grilled Veggie Wrap
ingredients: Assorted grilled vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, and eggplant); 2 tablespoons hummus; Whole wheat tortilla wrap
recipe: For grilled veggie wrap: Lay a whole wheat tortilla wrap flat. Spread hummus evenly over the wrap. Place assorted grilled vegetables on top of the hummus. Roll up the wrap tightly and slice in half diagonally. Serve immediately.

name: Egg Salad Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: 2 hard-boiled eggs, chopped; 1/4 cup diced celery; 2 tablespoons diced red onion; 2 tablespoons Greek yogurt; 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard; Salt and pepper, to taste; Large lettuce leaves
recipe: For egg salad lettuce wraps: In a bowl, mix together chopped hard-boiled eggs, diced celery, diced red onion, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper until well combined. Spoon the egg salad onto large lettuce leaves. Roll up the lettuce leaves to form wraps. Serve immediately.

name: Black Bean and Corn Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed; 1 cup corn kernels; 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper; 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro; 2 tablespoons lime juice; 1 tablespoon olive oil; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For black bean and corn salad: In a large bowl, combine black beans, corn kernels, diced red bell pepper, and chopped fresh cilantro. In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Greek Chicken Pita Pocket
ingredients: 100g grilled chicken breast, sliced; Whole wheat pita pocket; Mixed salad greens; Sliced cucumber; Sliced tomato; Crumbled feta cheese; Kalamata olives; Tzatziki sauce
recipe: For Greek chicken pita pocket: Warm the whole wheat pita pocket in a toaster or microwave. Stuff the pita pocket with sliced grilled chicken breast, mixed salad greens, sliced cucumber, sliced tomato, crumbled feta cheese, and Kalamata olives. Drizzle with tzatziki sauce. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Salad Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 2 cans chicken, drained; 1/4 cup Greek yogurt; 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard; 1 tablespoon lemon juice; 1/4 cup diced celery; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley; Salt and pepper, to taste; 2 bell peppers, halved and seeds removed
recipe: For chicken salad stuffed bell peppers: In a bowl, mix together drained chicken, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, diced celery, diced red onion, chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper until well combined. Spoon the chicken salad into halved bell peppers. Serve chilled or at roomtemperature.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 cups cauliflower rice; 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as peas, carrots, and corn); 2 eggs, beaten; 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce; 1 tablespoon sesame oil; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1/4 cup chopped green onions
recipe: For cauliflower fried rice: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender. Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix with the vegetables. Add cauliflower rice and low-sodium soy sauce to the skillet. Stir-fry until everything is heated through. Garnish with chopped green onions. Serve hot.

name: Greek Salad Wrap
ingredients: Whole wheat tortilla wrap; Mixed salad greens; Sliced cucumber; Sliced tomato; Sliced red onion; Kalamata olives; Crumbled feta cheese; Greek salad dressing
recipe: For Greek salad wrap: Lay a whole wheat tortilla wrap flat. Arrange mixed salad greens, sliced cucumber, sliced tomato, sliced red onion, Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese on top of the wrap. Drizzle with Greek salad dressing. Roll up the wrap tightly and slice in half diagonally. Serve immediately.

name: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
ingredients: 1/8 cup cooked lentils; 1 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, celery, and bell peppers), diced; 4 cups vegetable broth; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon dried thyme; 1 teaspoon dried rosemary; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For lentil and vegetable soup: In a large pot, combine vegetable broth, cooked lentils, mixed vegetables, minced garlic, dried thyme, and dried rosemary. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad Wrap
ingredients: 100g grilled chicken breast, sliced; Whole wheat tortilla wrap; Romaine lettuce leaves; Grated Parmesan cheese; Caesar salad dressing
recipe: For chicken Caesar salad wrap: Lay a whole wheat tortilla wrap flat. Arrange romaine lettuce leaves on top of the wrap. Place sliced grilled chicken breast on top of the lettuce. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Drizzle with Caesar salad dressing. Roll up the wrap tightly and slice in half diagonally. Serve immediately.

name: Veggie and Hummus Sandwich
ingredients: Whole wheat bread slices; Hummus; Sliced cucumber; Sliced tomato; Sliced red bell pepper; Sliced avocado; Mixed salad greens
recipe: For veggie and hummus sandwich: Spread hummus evenly on two slices of whole wheat bread. Layer sliced cucumber, sliced tomato, sliced red bell pepper, sliced avocado, and mixed salad greens on one bread slice. Top with the other bread slice. Cut the sandwich in half and serve immediately.

name: Chapli Kebabs
ingredients: 50g ground beef or lamb; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, finely chopped; 2 green chilies, finely chopped; 2 tablespoons coriander leaves, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For chapli kebabs: In a bowl, combine ground meat, chopped onion, chopped tomatoes, chopped green chilies, chopped coriander leaves, ginger garlic paste, cumin seeds, coriander powder, chili powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Divide the mixture into equal-sized portions and shape them into flat patties. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the kebabs until they are golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice; 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 1 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 potatoes, peeled and quartered; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; 1/2 cup chopped mint leaves; 1/2 cup chopped coriander leaves; Salt, to taste
recipe: For chicken biryani: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large pan, heat oil and ghee. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish. Add ginger garlic paste to the remaining onions in the pan and sauteuntil fragrant. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Add chopped tomatoes, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Cook until the oil separates. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside. Layer the cooked chicken masala and partially cooked rice in a large pot. Top with the reserved fried onions. Cover the pot with a tight lid and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until the rice is fully cooked and aromatic. Serve hot with raita or salad.

name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: 200g paneer, cubed; 1 cups spinach leaves; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; 1/4 cup cream
recipe: For palak paneer: Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then transfer to ice water. Drain and blend into a smooth paste. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Add spinach paste and cook for a few minutes. Add cubed paneer and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cream and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Aloo Palak (Potato and Spinach Curry)
ingredients: 2 potatoes, peeled and cubed; 2 cups spinach leaves; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For aloo palak: Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then transfer to ice water. Drain and blend into a smooth paste. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Add cubed potatoes and cook until tender. Add spinach paste and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Daal Chawal (Lentils and Rice)
ingredients: 1/4 cup lentils; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
recipe: For daal chawal: Wash lentils and cook with water until soft. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, salt, and cooked lentils. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Beef Nihari
ingredients: 150g beef, cubed; 2 onions, sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 2 tablespoons wheat flour; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh ginger slices, for garnish
recipe: For beef nihari: Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add cubed beef and cook until it changes color. Stir in wheat flour, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Add enough water to cover the meat. Close the pressure cooker and cook until beef is tender. Serve hot with naan or rice, garnished with fresh ginger slices.

name: Chana Masala (Chickpea Curry)
ingredients: 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chana masala: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Add cooked chickpeas and garam masala. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot with rice or roti, garnished with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Keema Matar (Minced Meat and Peas Curry)
ingredients: 200g minced meat (beef or lamb); 1 cup green peas; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro, for garnish
recipe: For keema matar: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add minced meat and cook until it's no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add green peas and simmer until cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Chapati Roll with Chicken and Salad
ingredients: 1 cooked chapatis; 100g cooked chicken strips; Assorted salad vegetables (such as lettuce, cucumber, bell peppers), thinly sliced; 2 tablespoons yogurt; 1 tablespoon mayonnaise; 1 teaspoon lemon juice; Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe: For chapati roll: Lay a cooked chapati flat on a plate. Spread yogurt and mayonnaise over the chapati. Arrange cooked chicken strips and thinly sliced salad vegetables over the sauce. Drizzle lemon juice over the filling. Season with salt and pepper. Roll the chapati tightly into a wrap. Serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Manchurian with Fried Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cups cooked rice; Assorted vegetables (such as cabbage, carrots, bell peppers), finely chopped; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 2 tablespoons corn flour; 2 tablespoons soy sauce; 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup; 1 teaspoon chili sauce; Salt and pepper, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For vegetable Manchurian: In a bowl, combine finely chopped vegetables, minced garlic, grated ginger, chopped green chilies, corn flour, soy sauce, tomato ketchup, chili sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well to form a dough-like consistency. Shape the mixture into small balls. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Fry the vegetable balls until golden brown and crispy. Remove from oil and set aside on paper towels to drain excess oil. For fried rice: Heat oil in a separate pan and add chopped onions. sauteuntil translucent. Add cooked rice and stir-fry for a few minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve vegetable Manchurian with fried rice.

name: Chicken Pulao
ingredients: 1/4 cups basmati rice; 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh mint leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chicken pulao: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add yogurt and green chilies. Cook until the oil separates. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and add it to the chicken mixture. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Garnish with fresh mint leaves before serving.

name: Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Chicken Breast
ingredients: 2 chicken breast fillets; 2 cups spinach leaves, chopped; 1/2 cup grated cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella); 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon dried oregano; Salt and pepper, to taste; Olive oil
recipe: For spinach and cheese stuffed chicken breast: Preheat oven to 375F (190C). Butterfly each chicken breast fillet by slicing horizontally through the middle, but not all the way through, to create a pocket. In a bowl, combine chopped spinach, grated cheese, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Stuff each chicken breast pocket with the spinach and cheese mixture. Secure the opening with toothpicks. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the stuffed chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted. Remove toothpicks before serving.

name: Dal Tadka (Tempered Lentils)
ingredients: 1/3 cup yellow lentils (moong dal); 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt, to taste; Fresh cilantro, for garnish
recipe: For dal tadka: Wash yellow lentils and cook with water until soft. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. sauteuntil onions are translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder and salt. Add cooked lentils and simmer for 5-10 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Beef Biryani
ingredients: 1/4 cups basmati rice; 100g0g beef, cut into small pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; 1/2 cup chopped mint leaves; 1/2 cup chopped coriander leaves; Salt, to taste
recipe: For beef biryani: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil and ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add beef pieces and cook until they are browned. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, salt, and yogurt. Cook until the oil separates. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and add it to the beef mixture. Layer with chopped mint leaves and coriander leaves. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Serve hot with raita or salad.

name: Chicken Hariyali Tikka
ingredients: 200g boneless chicken, cut into cubes; 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves; 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves; 2 tablespoons yogurt; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 2 green chilies; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Lemon wedges, for serving
recipe: For chicken hariyali tikka: In a blender, combine fresh cilantro leaves, fresh mint leaves, yogurt, ginger garlic paste, green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Blend into a smooth paste. Marinate chicken cubes in the green marinade for at least 1 hour. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers. Grill or bake until cooked through, turning occasionally. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
ingredients: 20g paneer, cubed; 2 onions, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked in water; 1/4 cup cream; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For paneer butter masala: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Transfer the mixture to a blender, add soaked cashew nuts, and blend into a smooth paste. Return the paste to the pan. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Add cubed paneer and cream. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Korma
ingredients: 200g mutton, cubed; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cashew nuts, soaked in water; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For mutton korma: Heat oil and ghee in a pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Transfer the mixture to a blender, add soaked cashew nuts, and blend into a smooth paste. Return the paste to the pressure cooker. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Add cubed mutton and yogurt. Close the pressure cooker and cook until mutton is tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Achari Chicken
ingredients: 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 tablespoons pickling spice mix (achaar masala); 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 2 tablespoons oil; Salt, to taste
recipe: For achari chicken: Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onions. Fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Stir in pickling spice mix and salt. Add chicken pieces and cook until tender and fully cooked. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Matar Paneer (Peas and Cottage Cheese Curry)
ingredients: 50g paneer, cubed; 1 cup green peas; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For matar paneer: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add green peas and cubed paneer. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Karahi
ingredients: 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chicken karahi: Heat oil in a karahi or deep frying pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add yogurt and chopped green chilies. Cook until the oil separates and the chicken is cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Aloo Gosht (Potato and Meat Curry)
ingredients: 150g0g mutton or beef, cubed; 3 potatoes, peeled and cubed; 2 onions, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For aloo gosht: Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add cubed meat and cook until it changes color. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add cubed potatoes and enough water to cover the meat and potatoes. Close the pressure cooker and cook until meat is tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Chapli Kebab
ingredients: 200g minced meat (beef or lamb); 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, finely chopped; 2 green chilies, finely chopped; 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped; 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger paste; 1 tablespoon garlic paste; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For chapli kebab: In a mixing bowl, combine minced meat, chopped onion, chopped tomatoes, chopped green chilies, chopped cilantro, chopped mint leaves, ginger paste, garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder, chili flakes, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Mix well to combine. Take a portion of the mixture and shape it into a flat round patty. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the kebabs until they are browned and cooked through. Serve hot with naan or roti.

name: Chicken Jalfrezi
ingredients: 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup tomato puree; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chicken jalfrezi: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add tomato puree, chopped bell pepper, and chopped green chilies. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Kofta Curry (Meatball Curry)
ingredients: 200g minced meat (beef or lamb); 1 onion, grated; 2 tablespoons gram flour (besan); 2 tablespoons yogurt; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For kofta curry: In a mixing bowl, combine minced meat, grated onion, gram flour, yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Mix well to form a smooth mixture. Shape the mixture into small meatballs. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the meatballs until they are browned and cooked through. Set aside. For the curry sauce, follow the instructions for chicken karahi (recipe #23) until step 5. Once the chicken is cooked, add the fried meatballs to the sauce. Simmer for a few minutes before serving.

name: Chicken Handi
ingredients: 200g chicken, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chicken handi: Heat oil in a handi or deep frying pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Add chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add yogurt and chopped green chilies. Cook until the oil separates and the chicken is cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Shami Kebab
ingredients: 250g minced beef; 1/2 cup split chickpeas (chana dal), soaked; 1 onion, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 1 egg; Salt, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For shami kebab: In a pressure cooker, combine minced beef, soaked split chickpeas, chopped onion, chopped green chilies, grated ginger, minced garlic, cumin seeds, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Add enough water to cover the ingredients. Close the pressure cooker and cook until the beef and chickpeas are tender. Once cooked, drain any excess liquid and let the mixture cool. Transfer the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth. Shape the mixture into flat round patties. Beat an egg in a bowl. Dip each kebab in beaten egg. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the kebabs until they are golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt dip.

name: Palak Paneer (Spinach and Cottage Cheese Curry)
ingredients: 70g paneer, cubed; 2 cups spinach leaves, chopped; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For palak paneer: Blanch chopped spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Blend blanched spinach into a smooth puree. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Add spinach puree and cubed paneer. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Pulao
ingredients: 1/2 cups basmati rice; 200g mutton, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt, to taste; Fresh mint leaves, for garnish
recipe: For mutton pulao: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil and ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add mutton pieces and cook until they change color. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, salt, and yogurt. Cook until the oil separates. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and add it to the mutton mixture. Add slit green chilies. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Garnish with fresh mint leaves before serving.

name: Chana Masala (Chickpea Curry)
ingredients: 1/2 cups chickpeas, cooked; 1 onion, chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For chana masala: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. Add cooked chickpeas and enough water to achieve the desired consistency. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Lamb Rogan Josh
ingredients: 250g lamb, cubed; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For lamb rogan josh: Heat oil and ghee in a pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add cubed lamb and cook until it changes color. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, salt, and yogurt. Close the pressure cooker and cook until lamb is tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Karri Pakora (Yogurt Curry with Fritters)
ingredients: 1/2 cups yogurt; 2 tablespoons gram flour (besan); 1 onion, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For kadhi pakora: In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, gram flour, turmeric powder, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and fenugreek seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions, chopped green chilies, ginger paste, and garlic paste. Cook until onions are translucent. Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and bring to a gentle simmer. Meanwhile, prepare pakoras by deep-frying small portions of gram flour batter until golden brown and crispy. Add the pakoras to the simmering yogurt mixture. Cook for 10-15 minutes until the flavors meld together. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 1/2 cups basmati rice; Assorted vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, cauliflower), chopped; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For vegetable biryani: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil and ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add assorted vegetables and cook until slightly tender. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, salt, and yogurt. Cook until the oil separates. In a separate pot, boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and add it to the vegetable mixture. Add slit green chilies. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Chapli Burger
ingredients: For chapli burger: Prepare chapli kebab mixture as described in recipe #25. Shape the mixture into burger patties and grill or pan-fry until cooked through. Serve the chapli kebab patties in burger buns with lettuce, tomato slices, onions, and your favorite condiments.

name: Karahi Gosht (Stir-Fried Lamb)
ingredients: 200g lamb, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For karahi gosht: Heat oil in a karahi or deep frying pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Add lamb pieces and cook until they are no longer pink. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add yogurt and chopped green chilies. Cook until the oil separates and the lamb is cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Keema Naan
ingredients: For keema naan: Prepare 100g keema mixture by cooking minced meat with onions, tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, and spices until fully cooked. Divide the keema mixture into portions. Roll out naan dough into circles and place a portion of keema mixture in the center. Seal the edges and roll out the naan again. Cook the stuffed naan on a hot griddle or tawa until golden brown and cooked through.

name: Fish Curry
ingredients: 100g fish fillets (any firm-fleshed fish); 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup coconut milk; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For fish curry: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add coconut milk and chopped green chilies. Simmer for a few minutes. Add fish fillets and cook until they are cooked through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Vegetable Pakora
ingredients: 1 cup chickpea flour (besan); Assorted vegetables (potatoes, onions, cauliflower, spinach), thinly sliced; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt, to taste; Oil, for frying
recipe: For vegetable pakora: In a bowl, combine chickpea flour, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Add water gradually to make a thick batter. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Dip assorted vegetable slices in the batter and deep fry until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind sauce.

name: Chicken Malai Boti
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into cubes; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cream; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon white pepper powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg powder; Salt, to taste; 2 tablespoons oil; Skewers
recipe: For chicken malai boti: In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, cream, ginger garlic paste, white pepper powder, garam masala powder, nutmeg powder, and salt. Add chicken cubes to the marinade and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers. Heat oil on a grill or grill pan over medium heat. Grill the skewers, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and has charred grill marks. Serve hot with mint chutney and naan.

name: Aloo Bharta (Mashed Potatoes)
ingredients: 1.5 large potatoes, boiled and peeled; 2 onions, finely chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup cilantro leaves, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt, to taste; 2 tablespoons oil
recipe: For aloo bharta: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add chopped onions and green chilies. sauteuntil onions are translucent. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a minute. Add boiled potatoes and mash them well with a potato masher or fork. Mix everything together and cook for a few minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Reshmi Kebab
ingredients: 300g boneless chicken, cut into cubes; 1/4 cup cream; 2 tablespoons yogurt; 2 tablespoons cashew nut paste; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon white pepper powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt, to taste; 2 tablespoons oil; Skewers
recipe: For chicken reshmi kebab: In a mixing bowl, combine cream, yogurt, cashew nut paste, ginger garlic paste, white pepper powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Add chicken cubes to the marinade and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers. Heat oil on a grill or grill pan over medium heat. Grill the skewers, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and has a golden exterior. Serve hot with mint chutney and naan.

name: Prawn Masala
ingredients: 100g prawns, peeled and deveined; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger paste; 1 teaspoon garlic paste; 1/2 cup coconut milk; 2 tablespoons oil; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt and pepper, to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
recipe: For prawn masala: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste, sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add coconut milk and chopped green chilies. Simmer for a few minutes. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink and opaque. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Torii Gosht
ingredients: 500g boneless mutton pieces; 2 onions finely chopped; 2 tomatoes chopped; 3 cloves garlic minced; 1-inch ginger minced; 2 green chilies chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
recipe: For torii gosht: Heat vegetable oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauteuntil golden brown. Stir in minced garlic minced ginger and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Now add boneless mutton pieces and sauteuntil they are browned on all sides. Sprinkle coriander powder turmeric powder red chili powder and salt. Mix well. Add enough water to cover the mutton pieces. Close the lid and pressure cook until the mutton is tender about 20-25 minutes. Once done sprinkle garam masala powder and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot withriceorroti.

name: Achari Gosht
ingredients: 300g mutton, cut into pieces; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1/4 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; 1 teaspoon fennel seeds; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt, to taste; Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
recipe: For achari gosht: Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add fenugreek seeds, fennel seeds, and mustard seeds. sauteuntil fragrant. Add thinly sliced onions and sauteuntil golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Add mutton pieces and cook until they are browned. Add yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add water and pressure cook until the mutton is tender. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Kali Dal and Chawal
ingredients: 1/2 cups basmati rice; 500g black lentils (Kali Dal); 2 onions thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes chopped; 2 green chilies slit lengthwise; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup cooking oil; 1/4 cup ghee; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala powder; Salt to taste; Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
recipe: For Kali Dal and Chawal: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Rinse the black lentils (Kali Dal) and soak them for a few hours or overnight. Drain and set aside. Heat oil and ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste and sauteuntil fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add the soaked black lentils (Kali Dal) and cook until tender. Stir in turmeric powder
column8: coriander powder red chili powder garam masala powder salt and yogurt. Cook until the flavors are well combined. In a separate pot boil water and add salt. Cook the soaked rice until it's 70% done. Drain the rice and add it to the Kali Dal mixture. Add slit green chilies. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves beforeserving.

name: Tamatar Ghosht (Tomato Meat Curry)
ingredients: 100g lamb/goat meat cubed; 2 tomatoes chopped; 1 onion finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic minced; 1-inch piece ginger grated; 2 green chilies slit; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt  to taste; 2 tablespoons oil; Fresh cilantro for garnish
recipe: 1. Heat oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pan. 2. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 3. Add chopped onions minced garlic grated ginger and slit green chilies. Saute until onions turn golden brown. 4. Add cubed meat and brown it well on all sides. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down and release juices. 6. Stir in coriander powder turmeric powder red chili powder and salt. Mix well. 7. Add a cup of water cover the pressure cooker and cook until meat is tender (about 20-25 minutes on medium heat). If using a pan cover and simmer until meat is cooked through stirring occasionally and adding more water if needed. 8. Once meat is tender uncover and cook until the gravy thickens to your desired consistency. 9. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. 10. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Vegetable Pulao
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice; Assorted vegetables (such as carrots, peas, beans), diced; 1 onion, sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece ginger, grated; 2 green chilies, chopped; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt, to taste; Fresh mint leaves, for garnish
recipe: For vegetable pulao: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pot and add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add assorted vegetables and cook for a few minutes. Stir in garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Add enough water to cook the rice. Cover and cook until the rice is done. Garnish with fresh mint leaves before serving.
